00090 /*
00091  * l_wait_event is a flexible sleeping function, permitting simple caller
00092  * configuration of interrupt and timeout sensitivity along with actions to
00093  * be performed in the event of either exception.
00094  *
00095  * The first form of usage looks like this:
00096  *
00097  * struct l_wait_info lwi = LWI_TIMEOUT_INTR(timeout, timeout_handler,
00098  *                                           intr_handler, callback_data);
00099  * rc = l_wait_event(waitq, condition, &lwi);
00100  *
00101  * l_wait_event() makes the current process wait on 'waitq' until 'condition'
00102  * is TRUE or a "killable" signal (SIGTERM, SIKGILL, SIGINT) is pending.  It
00103  * returns 0 to signify 'condition' is TRUE, but if a signal wakes it before
00104  * 'condition' becomes true, it optionally calls the specified 'intr_handler'
00105  * if not NULL, and returns -EINTR.
00106  *
00107  * If a non-zero timeout is specified, signals are ignored until the timeout
00108  * has expired.  At this time, if 'timeout_handler' is not NULL it is called.
00109  * If it returns FALSE l_wait_event() continues to wait as described above with
00110  * signals enabled.  Otherwise it returns -ETIMEDOUT.
00111  *
00112  * LWI_INTR(intr_handler, callback_data) is shorthand for
00113  * LWI_TIMEOUT_INTR(0, NULL, intr_handler, callback_data)
00114  *
00115  * The second form of usage looks like this:
00116  *
00117  * struct l_wait_info lwi = LWI_TIMEOUT(timeout, timeout_handler);
00118  * rc = l_wait_event(waitq, condition, &lwi);
00119  *
00120  * This form is the same as the first except that it COMPLETELY IGNORES
00121  * SIGNALS.  The caller must therefore beware that if 'timeout' is zero, or if
00122  * 'timeout_handler' is not NULL and returns FALSE, then the ONLY thing that
00123  * can unblock the current process is 'condition' becoming TRUE.
00124  *
00125  * Another form of usage is:
00126  * struct l_wait_info lwi = LWI_TIMEOUT_INTERVAL(timeout, interval,
00127  *                                               timeout_handler);
00128  * rc = l_wait_event(waitq, condition, &lwi);
00129  * This is the same as previous case, but condition is checked once every
00130  * 'interval' jiffies (if non-zero).
00131  *
00132  * Subtle synchronization point: this macro does *not* necessary takes
00133  * wait-queue spin-lock before returning, and, hence, following idiom is safe
00134  * ONLY when caller provides some external locking:
00135  *
00136  *             Thread1                            Thread2
00137  *
00138  *   l_wait_event(&obj->wq, ....);                                       (1)
00139  *
00140  *                                    wake_up(&obj->wq):                 (2)
00141  *                                         spin_lock(&q->lock);          (2.1)
00142  *                                         __wake_up_common(q, ...);     (2.2)
00143  *                                         spin_unlock(&q->lock, flags); (2.3)
00144  *
00145  *   OBD_FREE_PTR(obj);                                                  (3)
00146  *
00147  * As l_wait_event() may "short-cut" execution and return without taking
00148  * wait-queue spin-lock, some additional synchronization is necessary to
00149  * guarantee that step (3) can begin only after (2.3) finishes.
00150  *
00151  * XXX nikita: some ptlrpc daemon threads have races of that sort.
00152  *
00153  */
00154 static inline int back_to_sleep(void *arg)
00155 {
00156         return 0;
00157 }
00158 
00159 #define LWI_ON_SIGNAL_NOOP ((void (*)(void *))(-1))
00160 
00161 struct l_wait_info {
00162         cfs_duration_t lwi_timeout;
00163         cfs_duration_t lwi_interval;
00164         int            lwi_allow_intr;
00165         int  (*lwi_on_timeout)(void *);
00166         void (*lwi_on_signal)(void *);
00167         void  *lwi_cb_data;
00168 };
00169 
00170 /* NB: LWI_TIMEOUT ignores signals completely */
00171 #define LWI_TIMEOUT(time, cb, data)             \
00172 ((struct l_wait_info) {                         \
00173         .lwi_timeout    = time,                 \
00174         .lwi_on_timeout = cb,                   \
00175         .lwi_cb_data    = data,                 \
00176         .lwi_interval   = 0,                    \
00177         .lwi_allow_intr = 0                     \
00178 })
00179 
00180 #define LWI_TIMEOUT_INTERVAL(time, interval, cb, data)  \
00181 ((struct l_wait_info) {                                 \
00182         .lwi_timeout    = time,                         \
00183         .lwi_on_timeout = cb,                           \
00184         .lwi_cb_data    = data,                         \
00185         .lwi_interval   = interval,                     \
00186         .lwi_allow_intr = 0                             \
00187 })
00188 
00189 #define LWI_TIMEOUT_INTR(time, time_cb, sig_cb, data)   \
00190 ((struct l_wait_info) {                                 \
00191         .lwi_timeout    = time,                         \
00192         .lwi_on_timeout = time_cb,                      \
00193         .lwi_on_signal  = sig_cb,                       \
00194         .lwi_cb_data    = data,                         \
00195         .lwi_interval   = 0,                            \
00196         .lwi_allow_intr = 0                             \
00197 })
00198 
00199 #define LWI_TIMEOUT_INTR_ALL(time, time_cb, sig_cb, data)       \
00200 ((struct l_wait_info) {                                         \
00201         .lwi_timeout    = time,                                 \
00202         .lwi_on_timeout = time_cb,                              \
00203         .lwi_on_signal  = sig_cb,                               \
00204         .lwi_cb_data    = data,                                 \
00205         .lwi_interval   = 0,                                    \
00206         .lwi_allow_intr = 1                                     \
00207 })
00208 
00209 #define LWI_INTR(cb, data)  LWI_TIMEOUT_INTR(0, NULL, cb, data)
00210 
00211 #define LUSTRE_FATAL_SIGS                                        \
00212         (sigmask(SIGKILL) | sigmask(SIGINT) | sigmask(SIGTERM) | \
00213          sigmask(SIGQUIT) | sigmask(SIGALRM))
00214 
00215 /*
00216  * Wait Queue
00217  */
00218 #ifndef HAVE___ADD_WAIT_QUEUE_EXCLUSIVE
00219 static inline void __add_wait_queue_exclusive(wait_queue_head_t *q,
00220                                               wait_queue_t *wait)
00221 {
00222         wait->flags |= WQ_FLAG_EXCLUSIVE;
00223         __add_wait_queue(q, wait);
00224 }
00225 #endif /* HAVE___ADD_WAIT_QUEUE_EXCLUSIVE */
00226 
00240 #define add_wait_queue_exclusive_head(waitq, link)              \
00241 {                                                               \
00242         unsigned long flags;                                    \
00243                                                                 \
00244         spin_lock_irqsave(&((waitq)->lock), flags);             \
00245         __add_wait_queue_exclusive(waitq, link);                \
00246         spin_unlock_irqrestore(&((waitq)->lock), flags);        \
00247 }
00248 
00249 /*
00250  * wait for @condition to become true, but no longer than timeout, specified
00251  * by @info.
00252  */
00253 #define __l_wait_event(wq, condition, info, ret, l_add_wait)                   \
00254 do {                                                                           \
00255         wait_queue_t __wait;                                                   \
00256         cfs_duration_t __timeout = info->lwi_timeout;                          \
00257         sigset_t   __blocked;                                              \
00258         int   __allow_intr = info->lwi_allow_intr;                             \
00259                                                                                \
00260         ret = 0;                                                               \
00261         if (condition)                                                         \
00262                 break;                                                         \
00263                                                                                \
00264         init_waitqueue_entry(&__wait, current);                                \
00265         l_add_wait(&wq, &__wait);                                              \
00266                                                                                \
00267         /* Block all signals (just the non-fatal ones if no timeout). */       \
00268         if (info->lwi_on_signal != NULL && (__timeout == 0 || __allow_intr))   \
00269                 __blocked = cfs_block_sigsinv(LUSTRE_FATAL_SIGS);              \
00270         else                                                                   \
00271                 __blocked = cfs_block_sigsinv(0);                              \
00272                                                                                \
00273         for (;;) {                                                             \
00274                 set_current_state(TASK_INTERRUPTIBLE);                         \
00275                                                                                \
00276                 if (condition)                                                 \
00277                         break;                                                 \
00278                                                                                \
00279                 if (__timeout == 0) {                                          \
00280                         schedule();                                            \
00281                 } else {                                                       \
00282                         cfs_duration_t interval = info->lwi_interval?          \
00283                                              min_t(cfs_duration_t,             \
00284                                                  info->lwi_interval,__timeout):\
00285                                              __timeout;                        \
00286                         cfs_duration_t remaining = schedule_timeout(interval); \
00287                         __timeout = cfs_time_sub(__timeout,                    \
00288                                             cfs_time_sub(interval, remaining));\
00289                         if (__timeout == 0) {                                  \
00290                                 if (info->lwi_on_timeout == NULL ||            \
00291                                     info->lwi_on_timeout(info->lwi_cb_data)) { \
00292                                         ret = -ETIMEDOUT;                      \
00293                                         break;                                 \
00294                                 }                                              \
00295                                 /* Take signals after the timeout expires. */  \
00296                                 if (info->lwi_on_signal != NULL)               \
00297                                     (void)cfs_block_sigsinv(LUSTRE_FATAL_SIGS);\
00298                         }                                                      \
00299                 }                                                              \
00300                                                                                \
00301                 if (condition)                                                 \
00302                         break;                                                 \
00303                 if (signal_pending(current)) {                                 \
00304                         if (info->lwi_on_signal != NULL &&                     \
00305                             (__timeout == 0 || __allow_intr)) {                \
00306                                 if (info->lwi_on_signal != LWI_ON_SIGNAL_NOOP) \
00307                                         info->lwi_on_signal(info->lwi_cb_data);\
00308                                 ret = -EINTR;                                  \
00309                                 break;                                         \
00310                         }                                                      \
00311                         /* We have to do this here because some signals */     \
00312                         /* are not blockable - ie from strace(1).       */     \
00313                         /* In these cases we want to schedule_timeout() */     \
00314                         /* again, because we don't want that to return  */     \
00315                         /* -EINTR when the RPC actually succeeded.      */     \
00316                         /* the recalc_sigpending() below will deliver the */   \
00317                         /* signal properly.                             */     \
00318                         cfs_clear_sigpending();                                \
00319                 }                                                              \
00320         }                                                                      \
00321                                                                                \
00322         cfs_restore_sigs(__blocked);                                           \
00323                                                                                \
00324         set_current_state(TASK_RUNNING);                                       \
00325         remove_wait_queue(&wq, &__wait);                                       \
00326 } while (0)
00327 
00328 
00329 #define l_wait_event(wq, condition, info)                       \
00330 ({                                                              \
00331         int                 __ret;                              \
00332         struct l_wait_info *__info = (info);                    \
00333                                                                 \
00334         __l_wait_event(wq, condition, __info,                   \
00335                        __ret, add_wait_queue);                  \
00336         __ret;                                                  \
00337 })
00338 
00339 #define l_wait_event_exclusive(wq, condition, info)             \
00340 ({                                                              \
00341         int                 __ret;                              \
00342         struct l_wait_info *__info = (info);                    \
00343                                                                 \
00344         __l_wait_event(wq, condition, __info,                   \
00345                        __ret, add_wait_queue_exclusive);        \
00346         __ret;                                                  \
00347 })
00348 
00349 #define l_wait_event_exclusive_head(wq, condition, info)        \
00350 ({                                                              \
00351         int                 __ret;                              \
00352         struct l_wait_info *__info = (info);                    \
00353                                                                 \
00354         __l_wait_event(wq, condition, __info,                   \
00355                        __ret, add_wait_queue_exclusive_head);   \
00356         __ret;                                                  \
00357 })
00358 
00359 #define l_wait_condition(wq, condition)                         \
00360 ({                                                              \
00361         struct l_wait_info lwi = { 0 };                         \
00362         l_wait_event(wq, condition, &lwi);                      \
00363 })
00364 
00365 #define l_wait_condition_exclusive(wq, condition)               \
00366 ({                                                              \
00367         struct l_wait_info lwi = { 0 };                         \
00368         l_wait_event_exclusive(wq, condition, &lwi);            \
00369 })
00370 
00371 #define l_wait_condition_exclusive_head(wq, condition)          \
00372 ({                                                              \
00373         struct l_wait_info lwi = { 0 };                         \
00374         l_wait_event_exclusive_head(wq, condition, &lwi);       \
00375 })
00376 
00379 #endif /* _LUSTRE_LIB_H */
